snippet: Secretary of State John Kerry argued that Israel could not survive as both a Jewish state and a democratic state unless it embraced a two-state plan....
abstract: Sec of State John Kerry gives extraordinarily blunt speech largely blaming ongoing conflict between Israel and Palestine on Israeli Prime Min Benjamin Netanyahu; cites need to protect one of America's longest and closest allies from extreme elements in its own political culture; warns Netanyahu's continued support for West Bank settlements makes two-state solution increasingly impossible.

byline.contributor: Peter Baker contributed reporting from Jerusalem, and Michael D. Shear from West Palm Beach, Fla.

lead_paragraph: Secretary of State John Kerry argued that Israel could not survive as both a Jewish state and a democratic state unless it embraced a two-state plan.

headline.main: Kerry Rebukes Israel, Calling Settlements a Threat to Peace
headline.print_headline: Kerry Says Israel Keeps Sabotaging Peace Prospects
